intro: Tapanhuacanga laricoides, commonly known as the Andean larch, is a coniferous tree native to the high altitudes of the Andes. It is characterized by its needle-like leaves and cones, typical of the Pinaceae family. This species thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to the harsh conditions of mountainous regions. Its bark is often thick and furrowed, providing protection against extreme weather. The plant plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
